Reviews.Title: “A lovely family stay in Lido!”
Reviews.Author: LondonJonesFamily999
Reviews.Content: Nice modern apartment blocks with rooms decorated in the "old style". Kept very clean and tidy by the staff. Beds very comfortable, our shower room was a bit small. Sadly it was not warm enough to use the outside pool, which looked lovely! Gardens kept very well. Reception staff/management were lovely, spoke perfect English, and were very helpful with information about getting about etc. Breakfast was good, but not extensive (mind you the sugar coated, jam filled croissants were superb!), it could have been improved by having fresh fruit salad each day and boiled eggs maybe. Definitely recommended for families.

Reviews.Title: “venice 4 day visit”
Reviews.Author: jimmygreenough
Reviews.Content: This accommodation is on the Lido di venezia which is a short boat hop from the mainland Venice. It is spacious , it has a lounge kitchen , bedroom and separate bathroom. It is actually a 2 bedroom apartment if required. It has 2 balconies and the only downside to the rooms is that you can hear your neighbours in the bedroom.. Overall a nice place which I would rate both as a Summer sun holiday ( the nice beach is very close) or a cultural holiday with the wonderful mainland Venice or a combination. We did not find any restaurants of quality on the Lido but it is peaceful as opposed to the mainland which is hustle and bustle but fun.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: Vlad C
Reviews.Content: There is not a single bad thing that comes to my mind! The apartment was clean and spacious. A fully equipped kitchenette was available, that we used mostley for breakfast. The pool was perfect to take a bath in the afternoon even late in september. Regarding location: i choosed this hotel on purpose because it was situated in Lido, away from the busy and crowded Venice. But access to Venice is really easy: the vaporetto stop (line 1) is at a 10 to 12 minutes walk from the hotel. The trip with the vaporetto is max 15 minutes. If you choose to stay away from Venice for a day, the beach is just across the street. Finally, crossing from Lido to San Marco at sunset may be one of the most beautiful experiences to live.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and service”
Reviews.Author: macdonaldia
Reviews.Content: Super 2 bedroom apartment for the price of a hotel room. Friendly, helpful staff and great location. The lido has none of the claustrophobia of the main island, really felt like a holiday resort. Definitely recommend

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay while in Venice”
Reviews.Author: HMSG
Reviews.Content: Be warn you need to arrive before 8:30 PM thats when the lobby closes!!!! We arrived late due to a plane connection and the lobby was closed. Lucky that I had the phone number for the Hotel that Expedia provided and some one answered. The gentleman arrived with in 10 minutes and processed our check in. It was a great place to stay. Here are some pictures of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: christosDk
Reviews.Content: If you are visiting Venice, there is no reason to stay in the center. It is only 20 minutes boat ride from San Marco to Lido. The hotel prices are almost half price, and it is more quiet for resting after long days walking the canals. The restaurants in Lido are cheaper and the service better. If you are staying more than a day or two, buy a 3 or more days bus ticket, or the Venice tourist card. Any way we stayed at "Le Ville del Lido" for 5 days and was worth every cent we payed. The hotel is located 5 minutes walking distance from the Lido boat stop and the shopping area, where most of the restaurants, super markets are and only a few steps from the beach. It is built on a large area, by the sea. For those who don't like to walk, there is a bus stop just outside the hotel, however I am not sure how often the bus services this area. The building blocks of the hotel are around a large pool area, very suitable for families and small kids. The rooms are spacious, rustic style, heavy curtains, nice bathrooms, a kitchen area where cooking is possible. TV set (our was not working), hair dryer available. A nice thing for families is that the apartments have 2 bedrooms . There is also an internal staircase, leading to a very spacious veranda, with a parasol, sunbed, a table and chairs, for those who wish to take their breakfast outdoors,or relax and suntan.Room service available on a daily basis, the personnel is very polite and helpful. There is no restaurant in this hotel. There is wireless internet available, but NOT all of the buildings are covered, due to the distance from the reception were the router is located. In this case you can always visit the reception area where there is a salon to stay for as long you need to read your emails etc. This hotel is not smoking, but for those who smoke the veranda option is available. All in all that was an excellent choice, we saved a lot of money and our stay was perfect. I would definitely recommend this hotel, especially for families.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and delightful”
Reviews.Author: ChrisF
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay here for 4 nights in October having read the good reviews on Tripadvisor and we were not disappointed. I can only echo the good things already said here by previous reviewers. We found the hotel easily having taken the Alilaguna boat from the airport. We walked straight down the main street,(noting the Billa supermarket en route) turned right at the bottom, past the Hotel des Bains (currently being renovated) and then turned right and into the hotel. We were met by a friendly and helpful english speaking receptionist and were then taken to our appartment which was spacious and clean. There were just two of us, so the spare bedroom and bathroom were locked. The small kitchinette area was well equipped and proved very useful for breakfasts and we also cooked a couple of dinners too. There was no kettle so we boiled water for drinks in a pan, and strangely no tin opener! But anything else you could think of was there, including plenty of crockery, glasses and cutlery. It was good to have the extra space - a lounge/dining area with the kitchinette as well as our en-suite bedroom - especially on the rainy windy day we experienced, when we stayed in most of the day and a cramped hotel room would have been very restrictive. The pool area looked lovely - but it was too cold for dip - likewise for the beach - which is just across the road. The only criticicm we had was that of a lack of sound proofing. On several occasions we could hear the voices of our neighbours - though only when we were in our bedroom. However, we would not hesitate to recommend the hotel and would happily return.

Reviews.Title: “Le Ville Del Lido”
Reviews.Author: Deckard75
Reviews.Content: What a lovely, lovely place. Me and the Mrs went there as a weekend away few weeks ago. Stayed here as alternative to the busy St Marks. Staff friendly and the room clean, and beautifully decorated. Would not hesitate in going back!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: The_stone_traveller
Reviews.Content: Pros: 10 mins to vaporetta, then 15 mins to San Marco. Excellent facilities in room for self catering. Great location for beach- even on a poor weather day. Out of hotel then turn left. 'Billa' Supermarket 5 mins away on main street, sells all you'll need. Great roof terrace if sunny. Lots of places on Lido for a relaxing breakfast or dinner- much cheaper too. Cons: Hot water is from a tank. There is not enough for two showers so consider filling a bath (only less than halfway and you'll have to share the water) We got caught out on the first day! The hotel's threatening disclaimer. We were asked to sign a disclaimer that said we had to pay â‚¬50 if we didn't clean the kitchen to their satisfaction or broke a cup! We've never had this before, but the wording made you feel like you were back at school: "we will inspect the room on your departure, and charge if we are not satisfied". Spoke to the manager about it but he was insistent, so I gave him a wrong credit card number. He was satisfied and so was I, but then he wasn't aware! Didn't like his manner though, and this left a sour taste. Watch out for mosquitos with the bedroom window open- even in October!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay while visiting Venice”
Reviews.Author: helenTheNetherlands
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights with our 2 children (teenagers) and loved the hotel. The apartments were comfortable and clean with a small kitchenette. After a busy day in Venice it was very pleasant to return to Lido as a calm oasis. If the weather woulkd have been warmer, we defenitely would have dived into teh pool or sea just a few steps in front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay to see Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Iloveriella
Reviews.Content: Loved being able to escape the hustle and bustle of Venice. The views from Lido across to Venice were stunning and the water bus service was fast and reliable. Hotel was easy to find (straight down the main strip, right at the roundabout and look out for the street name on the right side of the road). Staff helpful and polite. The grounds of the hotel are so tidy and well kept. Pool looks lovely (was too cold to make use of). Room was lovely and clean and had everything. Great boutiquish decor. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Just perfection”
Reviews.Author: AnneBsmith
Reviews.Content: Read the reviews on here which is why I decided to stay. It was just perfect in every way. Lovely friendly staff, beautiful surroundings, peaceful, relaxing, excellent value for money. The Lido is the perfect escape from Venice Centre and definately the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!!”
Reviews.Author: jgn-7
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights in July as part of a six week trip. When I booked it, I imagined that this would be some relaxing down time for us after some busy touring. It was perfect. We arrived in Venice at the train station and took water bus #51 to the last stop which is Lido. I believe the #1 bus also ends up there, but is a longer route. We ended up taking a taxi to the hotel as we had quite a bit of luggage, but it really is only a 10 or 15 minute walk through town for those wanting to do some site seeing right in Venice. What a lovely place. A very nice man at reception checked us in and helped us with our bags. The room was very nice - separate room for our kids and a comfy room for us. Two bathrooms were a treat. They were very clean - smallish and maybe not the best water pressure, but very adequate. Had a lovely roof top patio with a table and chairs and there was a place to hang laundry. We didn't really use the kitchenette except for the fridge, and there wasn't a microwave, just a stove top. Teeny TV with lots of German stations, some Italian and a couple of English. But, we weren't there to watch TV. The whole property is covered with beautiful gardens and archways and the pool was wonderful. There were very comfortable lounge chairs with umbrellas and you can purchase ice cream and drinks from reception. My kids were in heaven after several days of trains and lots of walking. The included breakfast is served by the pool on nice days and in the basement on cooler days. Loved eating outside, and it was a nice breakfast with yummy pastries, fruits, toast, cheese,ham etc. It had seemed from the web site that there was a cost for internet, but we were given a code without cost. We couldn't get reception from our room, but could use our ipads sitting around the pool, which was just fine. The hotel is right across the street from a stunning beach. There are beach huts available to rent, but we just used our towels and baked in the hot sun. There is a little lunch place right outside the hotel on the way to the beach that was great for a quick bite. Reception gave us excellent suggestions for restaurants in town - and there were also many pizzerias and pasta places. Tons of gelato shops which of course we had to visit every day. There is also a very clean laundromat close by that was very welcome and handy!! You don't even have to buy the soap - it automatically dispenses into the machine! We did take the water bus to piazza San Marco to wander around one day. We were going to stay right in Venice later on our trip, so it wasn't a priority, but the kids loved the pigeons in the square! Once thing, the cost of the water buses was increased in the last year or so, and it is 6.50 euros, if I remember correctly, per ride per person no matter what stop you are getting off at. So, having to pay that much for each of us going and coming made for a very expensive day of transportation for a very short ride to the square. Oh well!! We loved staying on this little island - very cute, quiet and a nice little retreat from the busy, touristy areas. It seemed like a lot of Italians take their vacations here and have vacations homes. I would definitely stay here again if we are lucky enough to return to Venice. I would probably stay a few days here and then a few in the heart of Venice as it is such a unique and fascinating place.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: Tinago007
Reviews.Content: The Lido is an oasis on the edge of Lido island, 10 minutes walk from the water taxis. For anyone staying in Venice in summer, there is nothing better than coming back from a long day to relax at the side of a sparkling pool in large, well kept gardens. The apartments are clean and comfortable -just note that the cutlery is kept in the table in the living room! Our only downside was the psuedo Venesian decorations in the rooms, but that is easily ignored. Would recommend this hotel without exception!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and mix”
Reviews.Author: Mike_J1963
Reviews.Content: Staying on the Lido turns Venice from an overwhelming onslaught to a manageable experience, and the Lido beach provides the balance. Be prepared, the Lido is expensive, but so is everything in Venice

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel, Great Location & Superior Service”
Reviews.Author: Krazy4
Reviews.Content: Visited this hotel as part of a 3.5 week European adventure for our 25th wedding anniversary. Venice was our starting point, and we stayed at this hotel for 3 nights pre a 12 day cruise leaving from Venice. Out of all the places we travelled, we would go back tomorrow to Lido and stay at this hotel. Upon arrival at 8 pm, our reservations could not be located by Hotel management. Looking weary after a delayed 10 hr. flight, that left 5 hours later than expected, missing our direct water taxi stop for Lido, having to get off in Venice, to go back to catch a water bus, lugging our luggage up & down the steps of Venice, arriving in Lido 6 hours later than expected with no vehicle taxi to take to our destination, meant having to take the Lido City bus - Italians that spoke no english were GREAT - showed them the Hotel we were going to, with sign language welcoming us to join them on the bus, and then ringing for us to get off - in the dark getting off the bus, with no street lights and no signs for the Hotel; we turned left, instead of right; arriving at the Hotel @ 8:30 PM - the first thing the Hotel Mgr asked me, was what type of wine we would enjoy! I took the white, while hubby had the red. The Hotel Mgr proceeded to tell us, they did not have a reservation for us and unfortunately they were filled for tonight - Sat.-except for an emergency room that keep for their staff. I asked if it was clean and with hot water - I just wanted a shower! It was, but it was in the basement - of course! We took it - the Hotel Mgr helped hubby down the beautiful winding staircase (of course no elavator) to our room. By this time it was after 9 PM and were starving. Hotel Mgr provided directions to walking distance restuarants and off we were - in the dark, unlight back streets of Lido, having no ideal where we were going. Took the Hotel advice for dining, at a great rest., that had a back garden area - just what we needed. The next morn, a different Hotel Mgr noted there was a mix up between Expedia and the 3rd party Italian travel agency they use, and there would be no charge for last night. Our plans for Sunday were to travel into Venice and sightsee - which we did, after enjoying the included breakfast. The hotel staff moved us from the basement room to our booked garden room on the 2nd floor. Upon arriving back after our sightseeing day, we were warmly welcomed by all, and our suite had a beautiful, separate bedroom with a large bathroom and loads of cupboards, and a large sitting and dining area with fridge, kettle, toaster. We felt like we had arrived home - it was a lovely feeling. Staff once again provided us with great recommendations for dining, sightseeing on Lido, and the back area waters of Venice. It was an experience we loved, and the best way to start our adventure. We will be back, hopefully very soon, to enjoy this hotel's gardens, rooms and gracious hosts!

Reviews.Title: “Peace &Quiet”
Reviews.Author: foxybabe
Reviews.Content: I got this holiday through ebay and what a bargin it was.The weather was perfect as was the accommodation.The beach is just over the road. You also have your very own terrace with sea views,there's also a swimming pool & a whirlpool.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent stay, exellent location”
Reviews.Author: Tourist75
Reviews.Content: I spent some days here with my familiy. The location is exellent for the beach and for visiting Venice. About a ten minute walk to the boat to Venice and just across the road to the beach. We had a suite with to bedrooms and bathrooms and a living room with kitchen. Also a small "private" garden with chairs and where you can dry your towels, bathing suite. Exellent for a family. The boat to Venice only tolk a few minutes. We spent one part of the day at the beach or by the pool and the other part of the day in Venice. It was nice to return to Lido after a day in Venice as it is a much calmer place and less crowded. We hadn't much to do with the staff, but they seemed nice and helpfull. All in all, I couldn't be more happy with my stay at Lido de Ville. But I did miss having Wi-Fi in the appartment and I missed wine glasses in the kitchen :-)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful option just out of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Kaylana
Reviews.Content: Le Ville Del Lido suites are a fantastic option for those wanting to see all the sights of Venice, then come home to a relaxed, peaceful environment. To get to the Lido suites from the main train station/waterbus station is about 40-60 mins ride by boat. Then a couple mins by bus, or an easy 10 min walk. But once your on Lido, all the best bits of Venice are just a 15 min ride away, and the boats run so frequently! We saved heaps staying on Lido, as Venice city is quite pricey. For 4 people our top floor suite was perfect: two decent sized, well lit rooms, two bathrooms, a lovely lounge/meals area, and we cooked meals in our cute kitchenette. The pool and gardens are also very beautiful and overall the whole place is very clean and well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful relaxing but stimulating visit to Venice”
Reviews.Author: gareth-harris2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Ville Del Lido from 18 April 11 for 7 days and had a fantastic time. The appartment was perfect for us (2 young children - 7 & 9 years old). It was very clean and there were fresh towels every day. The decor does look a bit dated, but it is very well maintained. The garden was an added bonus and the pool, whilst a bit cold, was lovely. The hotel is about 10 mins walk from the water bus, but it is a pleasent stroll and makes sure that the location is very peaceful. It is literally just across the road from the beach and that is a real bonus with young children. Reception was fine but we had really little contact with the owners. It is the perfect location for families to enjoy going into Venice for a bit each day, but then returning after a few hours sightseeing to go to the beach / pool. I would highly recommend the 50 Euro all in travel passes available for all the water buses - it must have saved us a fortune.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious suite good location”
Reviews.Author: Lesley10
Reviews.Content: Hotel is situated in a quiet area ideally suited to those wanting a superb pool with sandy beach a stroll away. Clean suite with plenty of space and well decorated. Small kitchenette area useful as breakfast was not included in our very reasonable rate with booking.com. Venice is an easy vaporetta ride away but prices there are very high for drinks & meals. Weather not as good as we had hoped but nevertheless we had a good time exploring the surrounding islands. The locals are very friendly and many speak english. I would recommend this hotel for a short stay with its closeness to Venice its an ideal location. We were pleased with the facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing break away from the crowds”
Reviews.Author: daff201
Reviews.Content: Great apartments. We had a two bedroom with two balconies. Lovely and spacious. The decor inside doesnt really go with the modern exterior but apart from that no problems. Staff were helpful and would stay there again. Lido is lovely and would recommend to anyone who wants a quiet place away but only 15 mins boat ride from St Marks.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for your money near Venice”
Reviews.Author: MfamilyLondon
Reviews.Content: First the positives...the air conditioning worked well, the suites were fairly spacious, the front desk was very helpful, and the pool and nearby beach were a welcome relief from the very humid and hot weather. Laundry service at hotel was inexpensive and good. On the negative side...it was so hot that the long boat rides to Venice were almost unbearable. The rooms are dated but the room price was so reasonable that it made little difference to me. Internet is not available in all suites. Had to go to the lobby or near the lobby to use the internet. Breakfast was marginal. Venice is a very expensive city and this hotel is a good option for people who want good value for their money. Lido is a lovely island and I do not regret staying here. Lots of kids at the pool and a nice little playground for tots as well...

Reviews.Title: “Venice with a difference!!”
Reviews.Author: PhilnJen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from our second stay at Le Ville Del Lido and have been thoroughly satisfied with our stay once again. The staff are friendly, efficient and knowledgeable. The location for us is fantastic, as you are close enough to venice to have all the benefits with the regular vaparetto boats that run until late at night. The hotel is a short 10 minute walk from the vaparetto stop (depending on what your definition is of short) but there is a local supermarket, bakery, butchers and plenty of restaurants close by where you can sample the local produce at good value prices even with the poor Pound to Euro........15 cents for a cucumber....bargain!!!! The apartments are situated on the Adriatic side of the Lido and are about 50m from the beach (which is privately owned by the larger hotels and casinos). The accomodation is clean and spacious with two bedrooms, two bathrooms, a small kitchenette, a lounge, balcony and on both occasions we had a roof terrace. The apartments are set in beautiful gardens with koi ponds etc and there is a nice swimming pool (although we have not yet taken a dip in the pool). The apartments have a breakfast service included in the price which we feel was very good as there was food to cater for all our party's needs. The breakfast room always looks unused as the lady is constantly replenishing food as it is taken......very good! The staff on the front desk are great and one guy in particular is very knowledgeable on the best places to eat etc. It is generally cheaper to eat on the Lido and there are some nice places to eat on the main stretch as you leave the vaparetto stop. There are plenty of things to see and do on the Lido and it generally has a more tranquil, peaceful (local) feel to it. I would seriously recommend staying here as you get all the benefits of Venice whilst also seeing a contrast way of life on the Lido, all at great value. Clean, friendly, great location and good value!

Reviews.Title: “Honesty abounds”
Reviews.Author: GT7111
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying here Sept 8 to 11th 2008. Not only were villas comfortable & clean, the staff happy and very helpful with dinner reservations etc. Totally floored me with their honesty. We made a terrible mistake of leaving a bag on the ground in the carpark the day of departure. The bag sat in the open carpark for a number of hours in light rain until a chamber maid came across it. We where happily driving to Rome totally unaware of what we had done. How lucky were we? The bag contained a lot of cash a diamond watch, 2 Tiffany necklass and braclets sets plus, a passport, international drivers licience and most of my credit cards. The next morning when unable to find my precious goods normally kept in the safe phoned Le Ville. Marko answered... Oh yes, don't worry they are in the hotel safe we will keep them there for you. A quick flight back to Venice found all to be in order. Nothing missing ... and this is Italy. Cannot thank them enough. Our entire holiday (3 months) would have been over within the first 4 weeks.

Reviews.Title: “A Charming, Laid-Back Escape from Venice's Tourist Insanity”
Reviews.Author: RedChileLover
Reviews.Content: With the euro such a lousy value for American travelers, we sought out a reasonably priced Venice hotel that was not a dump. We were delighted to find Le Ville del Lido, a suite hotel set on the Lido beach island of Venice. For a total price including taxes of 90 euros a night, we had a very comfortable apartment-style suite with bedroom, living room and kitchenette, continental breakfast included. It is about a 10-minute walk from the Lido vaporetto (water bus) stop, with St. Marks Square about 15 minutes away by water bus. After sightseeing in Venice during the day we were always relieved to return to the Lido, which is much more mellow and relaxed, but it was always easy to return to central Venice in the evening if we wanted. The grounds of Le Ville are spacious and green with lots of lawn and shrubbery (it is an ideal place for families with younger children as they have space to play). A large pool had just opened for the season while we were there. Lido restaurants are a short walk away and the room had a small refrigerator. The staff is pleasant and helpful. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Family trip made easy by this hotel on Lido”
Reviews.Author: LondonSummer
Reviews.Content: Venice is such fun with kids, everything around you is the attraction rather than queueing for museums. Added bonus is no cars around, making walking with kids a pleasure, plus boat buses are fun and easy with kids. Lido is much quieter than central Venice so v. relaxing, with less crowds, especially out of high summer. Hotel was clean, friendly and good value. Breakfast adequate, and accomodation lovely. NB Venice much harder with a stroller (pram) - I would wait till 4+.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic base for Venice”
Reviews.Author: Rusty_Jones
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights here with my boyfriend in mid-september, and found it perfect for what we were after. Stayed in a one-bedroom ground-floor apartment, which was spacious and clean. The staff were extremely friendly, the breakfast good and the pool area fantastic. We'd never visited Venice before, so I wondered whether we should have booked a hotel in the city, but I'm glad we didn't. Although the city is beautiful, it was very very busy and we really enjoyed coming back to the Lido mid-afternoon and spending a couple of relaxing hours by the pool. The beach across the road was fantastic, but I'm ashamed to say we never made it into the sea as the pool at the hotel was too nice to leave. We headed back to Venice most evenings for dinner - as another reviewer says, the boat ride is magical, especially at night. On our final night we stayed on the Lido and had a delicious meal at one of the restaurants on the main street. Would have eaten on the Lido again if our trip had been longer. Best tip - buy a three day vaporetti pass. It costs 30E per person, but we hopped back and forth so much that we would have spent at least twice that buying single tickets. The hotel's very easy to get to - about 50 minutes and 12E from Marco Polo airport to the Lido, then a 10 minute walk to the hotel. The vaporetto ride to St Marks is just over 10 minutes, and the vaporetti run late into the night. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel. I hope to return to Venice, and when I do I'll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay on Lido”
Reviews.Author: mezzo50
Reviews.Content: We started off our Italy trip on beautiful island of Lido, which is a quick boat ride to Venice. The Ville del Lido hotel was awesome. We stayed in a suite -two bedrooms beautifully appointed with a generous bathroom and sitting area/kitchenette. There were stairs leading to a rooftop terrace with table and chairs. Just charming! The hotel has beautiful grounds and pool. My kids never wanted to leave! Breakfast room was downstairs and small, and breakfast was average. The boats to Venice were a good walk from the hotel, but manageable. We ended up taking a cab on days when we were really tired...only about 5 euros. Lido is a great escape from the crowds of Venice and there were some nice restaurants on the island. We would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic for families”
Reviews.Author: feedavis
Reviews.Content: Spent half term week here with our 2 children (aged 8 & 5). Very very stylish self catering apartments with a hotel feel - fabulous swimming pools. Continental breakfast is included in the price - this is in a room next to the Main Reception. We flew into Marco Polo, and the waterbus took about 40 mins to the Lido. From the Lido bus stop it is about a 10 min walk to the hotel. No problem with kids - the walk takes you up the main street with cafes, shops and numerous galati shops. Each day we went over to Venice on the waterbus - apx 10 mins to St Marks Square. We would have a late morning snack /ice cream, and then either lunch out or head back to the hotel for lunch in our apartment, rest and then an afternoon in the pool. I think whenever you go to Venice - the city will be busy with tourists, so it was fab to head off back to our restful apartment and pool each afternoon. In the evenings we either headed back to Venice for a wander and some dinner - or wandered into the main strip in Lido and ate there. A lot of the beaches on the Lido seem to be private, connected to certain swish hotels, but the main public beach is just a 5 min stroll from the hotel. Its very nice - and has a beautiful restaurant - right on the beach. This was great as our kids could eat their dinner and then go for a play on the sand right infront of us, and my husband & I could relax with a nice bottle of wine - superb! There is also another gelati shop next to the restaurant so if you dont fancy the dessert menu head for an ice cream. My husband & I had been to venice before on our own and stayed in the city, however I really enjoyed the views that we got everyday when we took the boat from Lido to Venice - absolutely spectacular -especially at night. Our money seemed to go a long way on the holiday - free breakfast at the hotel - lunch at the apartment or a cafe, dinners were fairly expensive as them seem to pile on a "per head" charge just for being there, and extras for bread etc etc. However unless you are a wine connosieur - the restaurant house wine was alway very quaffable where ever we went. There's lots of simple things to interest kids - feeding pigeons, ice cream, people dressed in festival costumes and masks. Also as you walk around the streets - there is no such thing as a Tesco - each shop seems to sell one line of goods - gloves, sweets, masks, wallets. Also lots of bridges to walk over the canals - stopping to catch different views, see Gondolas, play in the fountains. Very very good holiday.

HotelInfo.Name: Le Ville del Lido Suite Residence
HotelInfo.Address: via Bragadin, 38 | Venezia Lido, 30126 Venice, Italy
